attribute.name: MYSELF
attribute.label: My own names, IPs and aliases

attribute.name: FOOTER
attribute.label: Show/Hide ze-filter signature at warning message

attribute.name: FILTER_URL
attribute.label: Filter URL (to be included on X-Miltered header)
attribute.default: http : // ze-filter dot ensmp dot fr

attribute.name: POLICY_URL
attribute.label: Policy filtering URL - appended to reply messages
attribute.description: If your domain has a web page to inform people about your email policies, you define this option, with some URL, ze-filter will append a reference - **See POLICY_URL** - to each reply done in SMTP session

attribute.name: DAEMON_FILTER_DISABLE
attribute.label: SMTP daemons to disable filtering
attribute.description: When your MTA is listening of different IP addresses and ports, it may be useful to enable/disable filtering for some of them. E.g., if you want to filter incoming messages but not outgoing messages (this isn't yet implemented).

attribute.name: USER
attribute.label: Filter USER ID
attribute.description: The filter will run as this user ID

attribute.name: GROUP
attribute.label: Filter GROUP ID
attribute.description: The filter will run as this group IP

attribute.name: FILE_DESCRIPTORS
attribute.label: Number of available file descriptors (integer value or MAX)
attribute.description: Sets a limit on the number of file descriptors available to the filter : can be any value lower than the value set by the operating system (ulimit), or MAX to use that value.

attribute.name: FD_FREE_SOFT_LIMIT
attribute.label: Available file descriptors soft lower bound
attribute.description: When the number of file descriptors available is lower than this value, the filter will rejects connections coming from unknown NetClasses

attribute.name: FD_FREE_HARD_LIMIT
attribute.label: Available file descriptors hard lower bound
attribute.description: When the number of file descriptors available is lower than this value, the filter will reject all connections.

attribute.name: USE_SELECT_LIMIT
attribute.label: Available file descriptors limited by select function
attribute.description: Use the lower value between **FILE_DESCRIPTORS** and **FD_SELECT**. This option can be disabled if libmilter was compiled with **_FFR_WORKERS_POOL** or **SM_CONF_POLL**

attribute.name: CPU_IDLE_SOFT_LIMIT
attribute.label: SOFT CPU Idle threshold to accept connections
attribute.description: When the CPU idle ratio is less than this value, the filter will reject connections coming from unknown Netclasses. No control is done when this value is 0.

attribute.name: CPU_IDLE_HARD_LIMIT
attribute.label: HARD CPU Idle threshold to accept connections
attribute.description: When the CPU idle ratio is less than this value, the filter will reject all connections No control is done when this value is 0.

attribute.name: MAX_OPEN_CONNECTIONS
attribute.label: Maximum number of simultaneous open connections
attribute.description: This is the global number of simultaneous connections the filter will handle the same time.

attribute.name: SOCKET
attribute.label: Communication socket between sendmail and ze-filter

attribute.name: SM_TIMEOUT
attribute.label: Inactivity timeout (milter <-> sendmail connection)
attribute.description: The filter will close sendmail connections inactive for this value long. Busy servers shall be configured with a much lower value (~ 600 s shall be OK)

attribute.name: CTRL_ACCESS
attribute.label: How to do access control over control channel
attribute.description: You can disable access control (NONE) or define your rules at policy database (ACCESS). If you define the CTRL_SOCKET option listening with an IP address other than localhost you shall enable access control.

attribute.name: CONFDIR
attribute.label: ze-filter configuration directory
attribute.description: This is the directory where configuration files and tables will be put in.

attribute.name: ERROR_MSG_FILE
attribute.label: Notification template
attribute.description: This file contains templates for the notification messages sent when a virus or X-file is found inside a message.

attribute.name: AUTO_RELOAD_TABLES
attribute.label: Periodic configuration reload interval
attribute.description: When this value is greater than 0s, ze-filter will periodically reload configuration data.

attribute.name: MODULES_CF
attribute.label: Modules
attribute.description: Configuration file for dynamically loaded modules (not fully implemented)

attribute.name: LOG_SEVERITY
attribute.label: Add a severity tag to syslog lines
attribute.description: When enabled, ze-filter log lines have a tag like "[ID 000000 local5.notice]", useful in order to find lines with some specific priority (e.g. error)

attribute.name: CLUSTER
attribute.label: Filter sharing resources inside a cluster (spool/server)

attribute.name: LOG_GREY_CLEANING
attribute.label: Log results of greylist database maintenance

attribute.name: STATS_INTERVAL
attribute.label: Time interval used to dump periodical data (load, throttle, ...)

attribute.name: WORKDIR
attribute.label: ze-filter work directory (state and specific logs)

attribute.name: CLEANUP_INTERVAL
attribute.label: Quarantine directory clean-up interval
attribute.description: This option defined the periodicity at which the spool will be cleaned-up

attribute.name: QUARANTINE_LIFETIME
attribute.label: Quarantine
attribute.description: When the spool is cleaned-up, files older than this value will be removed

attribute.name: QUARANTINE_ADD_FROM_LINE
attribute.label: Add From line to quarantine file ?

attribute.name: ARCHIVE
attribute.label: Archiving messages
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, ze-filter will be able to save a copy of each message matching Archive policy.

attribute.name: CDBDIR
attribute.label: ze-filter constant databases directory
attribute.description: Path of the directory where constant databases are installed

attribute.name: DB_CACHE_SIZE
attribute.label: BerkeleyDB constant databases cache size
attribute.description: Size of memory cache used by constant databases

attribute.name: DB_POLICY
attribute.label: Policy database path
attribute.description: File name of policy database

attribute.name: POLICY_CONFLICT
attribute.label: What to do if users policy conflit
attribute.description: This option defines how to decide which policy shall be applied when a message is sent to more than one recipient with incompatible policies.

attribute.name: FROM_PASS_TOKEN
attribute.label: Token
attribute.description: Not yet implemented

attribute.name: TO_PASS_TOKEN
attribute.label: Token
attribute.description: Not yet implemented

attribute.name: RESOLVE_CACHE_ENABLE
attribute.label: Address resolution (IP address / hostname) cache
attribute.description: The address resolution cache is used to avoid DNS queries to resolve address resolutions when quering the filter for some statistics.

attribute.name: RESOLVE_CACHE_CHECK
attribute.label: Interval between cache maintenance
attribute.description: When enabled, this option defines the periodicity at which maintenance operations will take place.

attribute.name: RESOLVE_CACHE_EXPIRE
attribute.label: Expiration age of non refreshed entries
attribute.description: During maintenance, entries older than the value defined

attribute.name: NOTIFY_SENDER
attribute.label: Enable sender notification
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, notifications after virus or X-Files are sent to the message sender. This is, most of the time, a bad idea as virus are usually spread using forged addresses.

attribute.name: NOTIFY_RCPT
attribute.label: Enable recipient notification
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, notifications after virus or X-Files are sent to recipients

attribute.name: J_SENDER
attribute.label: Sender address used for notification message
attribute.description: This option defines the sender of notifications appearing in headers and, for some versions of the MTA, the enveloppe. If the special value **SENDER** is used, the sender will be preserved.

attribute.name: J_SUBJECT
attribute.label: Subject of replacement notification message
attribute.description: This option defines which will be the subject of the notification. If the special value **SUBJECT** is used then the message subject is preserved.

attribute.name: XFILES
attribute.label: What to do with X-files ? (OK, REJECT, NOTIFY, DISCARD)

attribute.name: XFILE_SUBJECT_TAG
attribute.label: Tag to be inserted on Subject

attribute.name: SCANNER_ACTION
attribute.description: This option enables the scanner and defines the action to perform whan a virus is found

attribute.name: SCANNER_SOCK
attribute.label: Communication socket between ze-filter and external scanner
attribute.description: This option defines the socket used by ze-filter to connect to the external scanner.

attribute.name: SCANNER_PROTOCOL
attribute.label: Protocol
attribute.description: This option defines the protocol to be used with the scanner : CLAMAV or INTERNAL. The latter protocol type can be used by a generic scanner (see example at contrib directory).

attribute.name: SCANNER_TIMEOUT
attribute.label: Timeout waiting for the scanner answer
attribute.description: This option defines the communication timeout between ze-filter and the scanner. After this delay, if the scanner doesn't answer, ze-filter will drop the scanner answer.

attribute.name: SCANNER_REJECT_ON_ERROR
attribute.label: Reject messages when scanner call returns an error
attribute.description: This option defines the appropriate ze-filter action when the scanner isn't available or times out : Reject (YES) or Temporary failure (NO).

attribute.name: SCANNER_MAX_MSG_SIZE
attribute.label: Max message size to pass to scanner
attribute.description: Only messages smaller than this size will be scanned.

attribute.name: SCANNER_SAVE
attribute.label: Shall messages be quarantined ???
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, messages with virus detected by the scanner will be left in quarantine directory after the transaction ends.

attribute.name: VIRUS_LOG_FILE
attribute.label: Detected Virus log file
attribute.description: Virus found will be logged in this file.

attribute.name: ACTIVE_LEARNING_MARGIN
attribute.label: Active learning used in the statistical filter

attribute.name: DB_URLBL
attribute.label: Database Real-Time URL Blacklist (used for content checking)

attribute.name: DNS_URLBL
attribute.label: DNS Real-Time URL Blacklist (used for content checking)

attribute.name: REGEX_MAX_SCORE
attribute.label: Stop doing pattern matching when score is reached

attribute.name: SPAM_REGEX_MAX_MSG_SIZE
attribute.label: Max message size to do pattern matching

attribute.name: SPAM_REGEX_MAX_MIME_SIZE
attribute.label: Max message size to do pattern matching

attribute.name: DUMP_FOUND_REGEX
attribute.label: Log founded regular expressions to file

attribute.name: ORACLE_STATS_FILE
attribute.label: Statistics for Oracle (dumped each STATISTICS_INTERVAL seconds)

section.name: Antispam content check - Resulting score handling

attribute.name: SCORE_ON_SUBJECT
attribute.label: Shall message score be inserted on Subject Header ?

attribute.name: SCORE_ON_SUBJECT_TAG
attribute.label: Tag to be inserted on Subject ?

attribute.name: XSTATUS_HEADER_HI_CONDITION
attribute.label: When to add a 'X-ze-filter-Status: HI' Header

attribute.name: XSTATUS_HEADER_LO_CONDITION
attribute.label: When to add a 'X-ze-filter-Status: LO' Header

attribute.name: XSTATUS_HEADER_UNSURE_CONDITION
attribute.label: When to add a 'X-ze-filter-Status: UNSURE' Header

attribute.name: XSTATUS_HEADER_HAM_CONDITION
attribute.label: When to add a 'X-ze-filter-Status: HAM' Header

attribute.name: XSTATUS_REJECT_CONDITION
attribute.label: Reject message if this regular expression matches score from X-ze-filter-score header

attribute.name: XSTATUS_QUARANTINE_CONDITION
attribute.label: If this regular expression matches X-ze-filter-score header, the message is quarantined

attribute.name: REMOVE_HEADERS
attribute.label: List of headers to remove
attribute.syntax: NONE | List of comma separated headers
attribute.description: X-ze-filter-Status,X-Spam-Flag,X-Spam-Status

attribute.name: REMOVE_SCORES
attribute.label: List of headers to remove
attribute.syntax: NONE | List of comma separated servers
attribute.description: X-ze-filter-Status,X-Spam-Flag,X-Spam-Status

attribute.name: CHECK_CONN_RATE
attribute.label: Enable connection rate limiting
attribute.description: When enabled, ze-filter will limit the number of connections, per SMTP client, evaluated on a sliding window of size 10 minutes

attribute.name: MAX_CONN_RATE
attribute.label: Max connection rate (can be redefined at j-policy database)
attribute.description: This option defines the default max connection rate. This value can be overriden by those defined at policy database.

attribute.name: CHECK_OPEN_CONNECTIONS
attribute.label: Enable simultaneous connections limiting
attribute.description: When this feature is enabled, ze-filter will limit the number of simultaneous connections, per SMTP client.

attribute.name: MAX_CONN_OPEN
attribute.label: Max open connections for a single IP on unknown network
attribute.description: This option defines the default max number of simultaneous connections per SMTP client. This value can be overriden by those defined at policy database

attribute.name: CHECK_EMPTY_CONNECTIONS
attribute.label: Check the number of empty connections

attribute.name: MAX_EMPTY_CONN
attribute.label: Maximum number of empty connections over 4 hours

attribute.name: DELAY_CHECKS
attribute.label: Delay reject decisions
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, reject decisions based on client behaviour (rate limits, too many errors, ...) are reported till the first SMTP MAIL command, when client authentication information may be available.

attribute.name: CHECK_BADRCPTS
attribute.label: Check the number or Bad Recipients

attribute.name: MAX_BADRCPTS
attribute.label: Maximum number of Bad Recipients over 4 hours

attribute.name: CHECK_SPAMTRAP_HISTORY
attribute.label: Reject connections from clients sending messages to spam traps

attribute.name: CHECK_RCPT_RATE
attribute.label: Limit recipient rate for each SMTP client

attribute.name: MAX_RCPT_RATE
attribute.label: Max recipient rate (can be redefined at j-policy database)

attribute.name: CHECK_NB_RCPT
attribute.label: Check the number of recipients for each message

attribute.name: MAX_RCPT
attribute.label: Max recipient per message for connections coming from unknown network

attribute.name: CHECK_MSG_RATE
attribute.label: Limit recipient rate for each SMTP client

attribute.name: MAX_MSG_RATE
attribute.label: Max message rate (can be redefined at j-policy database)

attribute.name: CHECK_NB_MSGS
attribute.label: Limit the number of messages per connection

attribute.name: MAX_MSGS
attribute.label: Maximum number of messages per connection

attribute.name: CHECK_FROM_RCPT_RATE
attribute.label: Limit recipient rate per from address

attribute.name: MAX_FROM_RCPT_RATE
attribute.label: Max recipient rate per from address (can be redefined at j-policy database)

attribute.name: CHECK_NB_FROM_RCPT
attribute.label: Check the number of recipients per from address for each message

attribute.name: MAX_FROM_RCPT
attribute.label: Max recipient per message per from address

attribute.name: CHECK_FROM_MSG_RATE
attribute.label: Limit recipient rate per from address

attribute.name: MAX_FROM_MSG_RATE
attribute.label: Max message rate per from address (can be redefined at j-policy database)

attribute.name: CHECK_FROM_NB_MSGS
attribute.label: Limit the number of messages per from address

attribute.name: MAX_FROM_MSGS
attribute.label: Maximum number of messages per from address

attribute.name: REJECT_BADEHLO
attribute.label: Check EHLO parameters
attribute.description: Enable verification of EHLO contents.

attribute.name: BADEHLO_CHECKS
attribute.label: EHLO parameter checks
attribute.description: This option defines which verifications shall be done on EHLO parameter.

attribute.name: REJECT_BAD_NULL_SENDER
attribute.label: Check Bad '<>' Sender Address
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, messages which sender is the NULL SENDER (<>) and sent to more than one recipient and the connection come from a SMTP client which NetClass isn't KNOWN

attribute.name: CHECK_BAD_SENDER_MX
attribute.label: Check Bad Sender MX
attribute.description: Enabling this option makes the filter check if the MX of the domain of the sender address is unreacheable, checking if the domain, hostname or IP address matches an entry at j-policy database.

attribute.name: DEFAULT_BAD_MX_REPLY
attribute.label: Default BAD MX reply.
attribute.description: SMTP reply for this option.

attribute.name: REJECT_DATE_IN_FUTURE
attribute.label: Check if message date is far in the future (> 24 hours)
attribute.description: Sometimes, spammers date the message in the future to make it appear at the top of unread messages.

attribute.name: REJECT_DATE_IN_PAST
attribute.label: Check if message date is far in the past (> 1 year)
attribute.description: This option can detect spams with malformed date. But this option can reject old legitimate bounced messages

attribute.name: REJECT_SHORT_BODIES
attribute.label: Reject messages whose body length is too short
attribute.description: Reject messages which body length is too short. Body length is evaluated on the raw body, including attached files, MIME tags, HTML tags, ... In other words, all chars from since the end of the last header till the end of the message. OBS : this feature doesn't reject messages coming from known networks, nor messages typically sent by mail list manager software.

attribute.name: MIN_BODY_LENGTH
attribute.label: Minimum body length
attribute.description: This option defines the minimum message body length to accept.

attribute.name: DROP_DELIVERY_NOTIFICATION_REQUEST
attribute.label: Drop headers requesting delivery notification
attribute.description: When this option is enabled, existing headers asking for delivery notification are removed.

section.name: Reverse resolution of SMTP client IP address

attribute.name: CHECK_RESOLVE_FAIL
attribute.label: What to do if client DNS resolution fails
attribute.description: Enable verification if client IP address has reverse resolution.

attribute.name: CHECK_RESOLVE_FORGED
attribute.label: What to do if client DNS resolution is forged
attribute.description: Enable verification if client IP address is forged (direct and reverse resolution matches).

attribute.name: MAX_BAD_RESOLVE
attribute.description: Maximum number of connections accepted on a temporal sliding window of length 4 hours, if SMTP client doesn't

attribute.name: RESOLVE_FAIL_NETCLASS
attribute.label: Resolve Fail NetClass
attribute.description: This option defines, if its value isn't empty, a network class (**NetClass**) to assign to unknown SMTP clients without reverse IP address resolution.

attribute.name: RESOLVE_FORGED_NETCLASS
attribute.label: Resolve Forged NetClass
attribute.description: This option defines, if its value isn't empty, a network class (**NetClass**) to assign to unknown SMTP clients which reverse and direct IP address resolutin doesn't doesn't match.

attribute.name: GREY_MODE
attribute.label: Greylist mode
attribute.description: This option defines if the filter is autonomous with its own data or if it's also access data in a j-greyd greylisting server

attribute.name: GREY_SOCKET
attribute.label: Remote Greylist Server Socket when running in CLIENT mode
attribute.description: When configured to access a j-greyd server, this option defines the IP address and port where j-greyd listens.

attribute.name: GREY_CONNECT_TIMEOUT
attribute.label: Timeout to connect go j-grey server when running in CLIENT mode

attribute.name: GREY_MIN_DELAY_NULLSENDER
attribute.label: Greylist delay for null sender messages

attribute.name: GREY_MAX_DELAY_NULLSENDER
attribute.label: Lifetime for pending entries (null sender messages)

attribute.name: GREY_MAX_PENDING_NORMAL
attribute.label: Max normal pending messages
attribute.description: The value of this option defines the maximum of entries waiting to be validated, per SMTP client, before adding new entries. Setting this option to **0** means ''no limit''.

attribute.name: GREY_MAX_PENDING_NULLSENDER
attribute.label: Max null sender pending messages
attribute.description: This option has the same meaning than GREY_MAX_PENDING_NORMAL, but applied to NULLSENDER.

attribute.name: GREY_COMPAT_DOMAIN_CHECK
attribute.label: Enable/disable domain compatibility (sender domain/SMTP client domain)

attribute.name: GREY_IP_COMPONENT
attribute.label: How to construct IP part of ntuple

attribute.name: GREY_FROM_COMPONENT
attribute.label: How to construct FROM part of ntuple

attribute.name: GREY_TO_COMPONENT
attribute.label: How to construct TO part of ntuple

attribute.name: GREY_REPLY
attribute.label: Greylisting reply
attribute.description: When the greylisting filter rejects a message, this defines the reply codes and message to be sent back.

attribute.name: GREY_DEWHITE_FLAGS
attribute.label: Which criteria utilise to purge greylisting databases ???
attribute.syntax: None BadResolve DomainMismatch BadRCPT SpamTrap BadMX BadClient Spammer All

attribute.name: GREY_LOG_FILE
attribute.label: The expired entries log file
attribute.description: This is the file where expired entries can be logged. **Don't enable this feature on busy servers**

attribute.name: GREYD_SOCKET_LISTEN
attribute.label: j-greyd Listen Socket
attribute.description: This is the j-greyd server listening socket.

attribute.name: GREYDDIR
attribute.label: j-greyd working directory
attribute.description: The directory where j-greyd will save its databases.

attribute.name: GREYD_CLIENT_IDLE_MAX
attribute.label: Maximum inactivity time (after this connection will be closed)
attribute.description: j-greyd server will disconnect clients inactive longer than this delay.
